intro: Phaseolus candidus f. appendiculatus, commonly known as the white kidney bean or white runner bean, is a variant of the common bean species native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pale green to white pod color and small, round seeds. The plant typically grows as an annual vine, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with trifoliate leaves and showy white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This cultivar is often cultivated for its edible beans, which are used in various culinary dishes.
